Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good price, friendly staff, small room”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodDuo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March with my wife. There is construction going on out front in the street so I would ask for a room that does not face the street as the early morning jackhammer starts around 8 am. The location is awesome, 10 minute walk to many great tourist spots like Notre Dame and the Louxembourg Gardens. Lots of bars/restaurants in the area as well. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The price is very good, especially for Paris. My only real complaint is that the room was very small. There wasn't really even room for anything but a small suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Australiafrancophile
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in August and 3 nights in September.I chose the hotel based on location, airconditioning and price, supported by favourable reviews on Tripadvisor. There was no problem with the booking process over the internet even though I made 4 partially overlapping bookings.I was also booking for a friend for the 3 nights and my father for 11 nights. I caught the RER to and from CDG airport with no problems.It is not far to walk to the hotel. Please Note: It can be problematic getting a taxi from the hotel-a taxi issue not a hotel problem. The location is really great for sightseeing. A very easy walk to Notre Dame and the Luxembourg gardens and walkable to the Louvre and Beaubourg.My 80 year old father stayed there on his own for 8 nights and happily pottered around the local area finding things that interested him.He also tried the hop on hop off bus which has a stop nearby. I had two inside rooms, which I requested.They were very comfortable, clean and reasonable size.The bed was comfortable.I used the air conditioning because it was quite a warm spell at the end of September. The staff are friendly, helpful (eg with bus routes etc) and all who I encountered speak excellent English.Madame Cheval, the proprietor was especially kind to my 80 year old father. There is a computer and free internet in the lobby for people like myself (and my Dad!) who don't have their own wifi devices. The breakfast for 8 euros was very good, especially the fresh fruit salad and fresh whole fruit. Overall, a very comfortable stay, in a welcoming hotel in a fabulous location .

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamTim
Reviews.Content: Well located close to the St Michel Metro. Hotel staff are friendly and welcoming. The room was small, but is normal for Paris. The bathroom was modern and included an over bath shower. Breakfast was good value at 8 euros. Usually it included: fresh fruit salad, with different fruits each day, dried fruit, cereals, a jug of hot chocolate or pot of coffee, croissants,bread, jam, cheese and yoghurt. It was a filling meal and kept me going until lunch.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want!”
Reviews.Author: gettalife
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diana is boutique, well priced, clean, and very well located for walking & Metro travel around Paris Breakfasts are well worth the extra 8 Euros. Rooms are small - but who lives in their room in Paris (front rooms have opening windows, a little noisy from street, but allow you to soak up the atmosphere) Madame Therese & her staff are extremely helpful & most speak good English. Laundrette, supermarkets, bookstores, gift shops, cafes, restaurants, bus stops all within 5 minutes walk. 10 mins from RER St Michel Notre-Dame; 3 mins from Metro Cluny - La Sorbonne We're particularly fond of Restaurant Jardin Notre-Dame (head down Rue Saint Jacques towards Seine - it's on corner with alley (Rue de la Hutchette) just before Quai St. Michel. Or any of the kebab shops down the alley A great location right in the heart of the Latin Quarter - cross the Seine to Notre-Dame (10 mins) or walk to the Louvre or Musee D'orsay (30 min) We will always stay here when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: skluvstraveling
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday and booked it because of all the positive reviews on this site. Everything was true, perfect location with many cafes and shops. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and they spoke English very well which helped. You can eat very cheap and live on the baguettes and delicious crepes. First time I've been back for 12 years and what a delight in the difference of the most friendly and helpful people we ran across everywhere! We will definitely be back soon and will stay at same hotel. Penny and Sue (Chicago-2/23/12)

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JenHopek
Reviews.Content: Great location! Close to the Metro and tons of shops, cafes and sights. Staff were very helpful and able to answer all of our questions about trains, post office locations and restaurant choices. Great value for the price... Ask for a room away from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Love this little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_guest
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Diana hotel twice and highly recommend it. First of all, a brilliant location: it's in a charming intellectual-feel Paris quartiere (a stone's throw from Sorbonne and easy walking distance to nice piazzas, cafes, bookshops, cathedrals -including Notre Dame -, the Seine and the Metro!) The owner at the time (Therese) was very helpful both at the booking stage (I asked for suggestions of nice real-non-touristy Parisian restaurants to which she promptly replied with a list to choose from) and during our stay, attending to our every need in a helpful manner. Rooms were a bit small but comfy and brilliantly clean.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Inbar_Y
Reviews.Content: Very well located, clean and eficient. Small rooms but more than acceptable for a prime location in Paris (just in front of the Sorbonne), for sure at this rate. WIFI free in the room worked well. Plenty of sigths and nice restaurants around. Very recomendable !!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SpachNZ
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights in the hotel in January 2012. The staff were friendly and helpful, suggesting lots of places to visit and asking how your day had been when you returned. They showed a real interest in you, which for a Paris hotel I found a real treat! The location is very good, no more than 5 minutes walk from Notre Dame RER (take exit #3), which makes it very easy to get to and from CDG Airport. Our room faced the main street, but with two double glazed windows there was very little noise from outside. The rooms are a bit on the small side. We had the breakfast (cereal, pastries, toast, yoghurt, tea/coffee) and for 8 euros it is OK value, though if you just want a pastry you should go elsewhere. There is free wifi which worked fine in our room. For the location, service and price this hotel is well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Dwee_21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a central location within walkable distance to Notre Dame, the area around seems to be pretty safe and we have no trouble walking back to the hotel from the metro (St Michel/Cluny) late at night. But what makes this hotel truly stands out is the service that we have got, the hotel staffs are extremely friendly and went out of their way to give us advice on where to go for good Parisians food or sightseeing places. Definitely a place I will recommend to fellow travellors. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Unfailing support for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: o2bnfr
Reviews.Content: From the first "bonjour" to the last "au revoir" from the staff at this hotel, I felt a wonderful feeling of being "at home." The location is terrific - 5 minutes from the St. Michel RER line B stop from the airport, 5 minutes to Notre Dame. Within a block or 2 is: a laundromat, a small grocery, post office, SNCF city office, the Cluny Museum, Luxembourg Gardens and lots and lots of restaurants. All of the staff are very helpful with ideas for your day, and are just nice people who will chat with you. I even had a very welcome French lesson which helped my rusty language skills. I simply love this hotel. The single rooms are small - but wonderfully efficient. The WiFi was a pleasant surprise for me on this trip. Oh, and the breakfast has a wide variety and sustains you through your day of walking. My thanks to the staff of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Place, Nice Location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: sypremeks
Reviews.Content: Chose this place based on a few good reviews and I am glad that I did. Rooms were small, but clean. The hotel was pretty simple, but the owner Thomas was very helpful. The woman who cooked our breakfast was great, and we enjoyed having some good food to start off our busy days of touring Paris. The guy at the desk at night was really fun and friendly, my fiance and I ended up having a very long conversation with him and his friend and learned a lot about living in Paris. Hotel was in a great location for touring and was a good value. Great hotel for any type of traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: jeanr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in September 2011, at the beginning of our trip, and had a most enjoyable stay. The room was small but very clean, nice thick towels, had a/c, a fridge and kettle. The free wifi worked well, and there was a flat screen TV. We looked out onto an inner courtyard so there was no noise at night The booking process was unusual for Paris hotels, no credit card details taken as others have mentioned, but I confirmed our stay the week before and everything went smoothly. We found the staff really wonderful, they all spoke good English and nothing was too much trouble.Can certainly recommend, it's very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cosy place”
Reviews.Author: chaitealatte
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Location is excellent, close to St Michel and Cluny La Sorbonne metro and rer stops. Lots of food places and shops close by to buy food and drinks. Easy walking distance to Notre Dame and Pantheon, not so close to Eiffel Tower and Arc du Triomphe but still walkable. Room was comfortable and quiet, bathroom in good working condition, front desk friendly enough and speaks decent english. Was very happy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a single traveler in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jgm_09
Reviews.Content: I based my booking for a hotel in Paris purely on the reviews of Trip Advisor. I was looking for a good, clean, affordable hotel in Paris, and Hotel Diana came up as meeting this criteria. This is exactly what it is: a good affordable clean hotel right in the heart of Paris. Like other hotels in Europe, the room and bathroom were smaller than US standards, but it was very functional. The room might have been crowded had I been taking a large bag. Instead, I had two smaller bags, which made it easy to organize in the room (and get around Paris, too). The room was older, but it was very clean and well maintained. The bed was bigger than a normal single, and it was comfortable, too. The water pressure in the shower was better than what I have in the US (a big pet peeve of mine!). The staff was very nice and helpful. They all spoke perfect English and they were all willing to help or accommodate in any way they could. The breakfast was simple but very good. The location is good for tourist sights and there were several convenience stores close by the hotel. The neighborhood was fairly quiet, though early on in the night, it could be a bit noisy from the street traffic if the window was open. When closed, I didn't hear a thing. The only negative had nothing to do with the hotel, but it had to do with the neighborhood. Not too far away was a very touristy area, and the restaurants there reflected this. If you wanted a close bite, you had the tourist trap restaurants. You needed to plan ahead to get away from these joints, which the staff of Hotel Diana will gladly help you find. Overall, a good hotel for a good price. As a single traveler, it is exactly what I wanted, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little pied-a-terre in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SDTraveler12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from over a week in France, ending with three days, four nights in Paris. It was our second time their together, but he had been there before. Here are our thoughts: Location: Excellent location, just 3-4 blocks from Notre Dame, in the busy Latin Quarter district. As others have said, no, this isn't a super quiet street (we could see the Sorbonne from our balcony), but it's off the main drag and I didn't go to Paris to be shut away from the sights and sounds of one of the best cities in the world. Proximity to metro/RER is almost unbeatable- we left our rented car at CDG and returned to Paris by RER, I think about 1.5 blocks from the hotel. Room: We had a street-side room (the smallest they offer) and I was thrilled- big windows, plenty of natural light, quiet enough at night with the windows shut (double pane), comfy bed (although we were so tired at the end of each day of sightseeing that it could have just been that we were exhausted and passed out), a closet (!!), mini-fridge (!!), small desk, small flat screen tv, full-length mirror, and good size bathroom (with built-in hairdryer). I have no idea why anyone would call the bathrooms at Hotel Diana small-- compared to anywhere else in Paris (or France that matter--- I had to shower OVER a toilet in Lyon), this bathroom was modern, roomy, and pretty darn fancy. My husband has stayed in four-star hotels in Paris and said he thought our room was by far the best he had stayed in. And, yes, the room is definitely on the small side if you compare it to US motels/hotels, but not for Paris. It was perfect for the two of us and our stuff. Price: Very good for what we got (especially considering it was Paris and October is still considered high season). We did not partake in the breakfast so I don't know whether it was worth it. Service: There was always someone at the front desk. You have to drop your keys off/pick them up when you come back. (The only snag we had was one afternoon when we came back for a nap and housekeeping tried to get into our room twice while we were trying to sleep-- what is the point of collecting our keys from us, knowing that we are "in," if you're going to wake us up in the afternoon? Oh well.) Very friendly service and each one could converse in English. Reservations: This was a little weird- as others have said, they do not hold a credit card, but you have to reconfirm by email a week in advance. I was concerned about this, but there was no problem. To make myself feel better, we called the day we were going to arrive to let them know we probably wouldn't be in until 10pm and they said no problem. Overall assessment: A great, comfortable place to stay in Paris. We loved being able to walk to some major sights very close (Pantheon, Sorbonne, Notre Dame, Jardin du Luxembourg), hop on the metro/RER very quickly, and have TONS of food options nearby. Will definitely stay here again if we ever make it back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: lightning07
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 4 nights last Sept 2011. It was a very good experience. Booking was easy, I just sent an email to reserve the room and was told to re-confirm 1 week prior to arrival. The hotel is located near Notre Dame and it is convenient if you are riding the train to/from CDG, Orly and Versailles. We got there early, so we left our luggage with them until the room was ready. The room itself was clean and had most of the amenities you would expect from this type of hotel. The owner and staff were nice and easy to talk to. All in all, we did not have a single problem with the hotel during our stay. Some things you might consider (which were not really a problem for us) are: -The room and bath are small, but I think this is to be expected in Paris. -If you are in a room facing the street, it will be noisy if your windows are open. However, closing the double windows can keep most of the noise out. Sometimes, you can also hear people talking from the hallway, etc...

Reviews.Title: “very good!”
Reviews.Author: mikshaza
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there for a week, not for the first time in Paris. I will summarise: -Location is great! both for seeing many of the sites and monuments without having to use the Metro, AND for drinking, eating and hanging out in the evenings. And, the Metro is close by if you do want to travel a bit further away. -Room is very clean (they clean every day), shower is great. It's small but very typical. However, there is no view from the room and the bed is not the most comfortable one -Staff is friendly and helpful -The hotel is in a main street, very safe to walk alone at night. -It's 5 minutes walk from the middle of the tourist area of small streets with restaurants and bars. However, it is not the most romantic street in Paris. We didn't mind really since the atmosphere is everywhere. -Don't take the 8 Euro breakfast, you can find cheaper breakfasts all around unless you like a very big meal in the morning. Enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Locatio, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Bellman01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 6 days and enjoyed every moment at this hotel because of location, charm, cleanliness and top quality service. Mrs Cheval and her staff are so welcoming and helpful in every aspect of our stay. Although our room was small it was very clean and quiet and enjoyed being at walking distance from major attractions including quarter Latin. A definite must go back. En resumer nous recommandons fortement cet hotel. From Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Howard475
Reviews.Content: Very close to Notre Dame and the Metro in the Latin Quarter. Quiet street, but yet convenient for sight seeing. The rooms were very clean and decent size. The staff was very helpful and informative. We would stay there again for sure the next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: abhan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in my second trio to Paris and wish we would have stayed here on our first trip! The location was fantastic. Close to 2 metro stops, sights, and plenty of cafes and restaurants. We really couldn't have asked for anything more. Room was quiet as we did not face the street.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Little Place”
Reviews.Author: wanderk
Reviews.Content: I went there with my fiancé last year, I can't believe I failed to write a review of this awesome place soon. Booking the hotel is very easy, you just needed to email them and they were very quick on their replies (and they didn't even ask for any credit card info). It was first time in Paris for the both us and the staff were very helpful on giving us directions and tips on where to go and what to see. The location was awesome, we walked from there to the Pantheon, Notre Dame Cathedral, Louvre, Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower. Our room while small was very comfortable and clean. The Wi-fi was a little bit wonky, but hey you're in Paris, get off your laptops! I would definitely recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bugoaica
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very clean and centrally located. The breakfast is excellent....and the hotel landlady is a kind person, really caring for her guests satisfaction. A good value for the money. Really worth staying while in Paris, for business or tourism...

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place, super close to Notre Dame!”
Reviews.Author: MrsAtkins85
Reviews.Content: This petite hotel was very accommodating to me and the friends I travled with for a study abroad. The room I had was very nice, with a wonderful street view. Everything was comfortable, clean, and good. The breakfast was only 8 euros per person (a very good deal), and was wonderful. Fresh fruit, coffee, and your own basket of pastries. The location is also excellent. It's maybe two blocks from Notre Dame, and a fairly short walk to the Louvre, etc. Notice: the lift is very small! We were able to cram 4 people in it, but you wouldn't want to try it with strangers! Also, you need to leave your key with the desk every time you leave the hotel. If I return to Paris, I will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price and location !”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQuebec
Reviews.Content: Not very luxous but very clean,quiet and a number one service! Room are small (but nothing unusual for Paris) and the bathroom is very clean and refurbished. Very good breakfeast at cheap price ! A rare little gem at a cheap price in the middle of Paris...won't last forever..... :-)

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: twiglet101
Reviews.Content: I took my partner to Paris for his 30th birthday and Hotel Diana helped to make the stay a lovely one. The hotel is easily accessible, and is right on the edge of the tourist/student district, which meant lots of cheap food and touristy bars nearby. We used the velib scheme most days and there was a stand right across the road. The staff on the front desk were very friendly and chatty, and offered us help when we needed it. They printed our boarding passes for our return flight and allowed us to store our luggage on the check out day. The room was not huge, but perfectly okay for a couple on a short break. The bathroom was very clean and serviced every day. The wifi was a good connection and meant that my partner could skype his family on his birthday which was really useful. I would recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: PAVIATampa
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and their staff! They would make recommendations to make your trip more enjoyable. They go the extra mile to show you how to get around on a map, searching on the internet or showing you where the bus station is. The rooms are small by American standards but you don't need more if it is at a reasonable price and you are within walking distance from the main attractions. Good size bathroom. Stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed their breakfast very much. Other places around open later in the morning. The train station that takes you from and to the airport is a 7 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: kegearhart
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great location to spend our 1-day in Paris before heading home. It is situated just a few blocks from Notre Dame on the Left Bank. The owner is charming and the rooms and hotel are typical of old Paris. They are clean and comfortable and are wonderful for those more interested in sightseeing than spending a lot of time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Clean”
Reviews.Author: harping
Reviews.Content: This really is a perfect choice for a small reasonably priced hotel in Paris. Close to everything, rooms have all you need, exquisitely clean. Mme Cheval, Sahar, and the rest of the staff are all kind and accommodating. Highly recommended. Only small glitch is the wifi--sometimes fine, but at busy times when most guests are in, it can be slow to impossible to connect. Otherwise, can't rate the Hotel Diana highly enough. Incidentally, if you don't want breakfast in the hotel (I was out too early most mornings), the little brasserie next door has excellent coffee for euro 1.20.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Henri255068
Reviews.Content: My wife and I who are in our early sixties stayed five nights at the Hotel Diana, Paris, in May 2011. Prior to booking we read the tripadvisor reviews and decided to book. We tried to book well in advance however we were advised the hotel did not accept bookings more than two months in advance. We booked exactly two months in advance and received an email from the hotel advising us a room had been allocated to us and that we were required to confirm our booking by email one week in advance. We did this and subesquently arrived at the Hotel Diana and the receptionist was expecting us. We were allocated a room on the third floor with a street view. There was a lift operating to the third floor. Our room contained a small cooler, a water boiler, a safe, double bed, desk, two chairs, a television, air conditioning, and a relatively new bathroom. The bedroom was basic and clean. The bedroom and bathroom were serviced daily. We made an effort to speak with the staff and we found them friendly and helpful. We took up the offer of the breakfast provided by the hotel at eight euro each and found the breakfast was good value when compared with the local restuarants. As new arrivals in Paris we arrived at the Guard de Nord and we caught the metro to Cluney Station. With the assistance of a map we found the Hotel Diana which was about a five minute walk from Cluney Station. Our opinion is that the Hotel Diana is ideally located to see Paris and is situated in what we considered to be a safe area and was in walking distance to many of the attractions. The hotel was close to two metro stations, Cluney, and St Michel. We found we could go out in the morning and easily return to the hotel for a rest before venturing out in the afternoon and evening. Although there was a water boiler provided in the room there were no cups or tea or coffee provided. We purchased two cups and coffee and were able to have a coffee in the room when we felt like one. There were no downsides to the hotel for us but do not expect five star accommodation. We also found that many of the other guests staying at the hotel were people of a similar age to us. The hotel had limited free internet in the reception area which was available to guests. Overall we were satisfied with the accommodation as we had a good idea of the standard from our prior reading of the information from tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian location, great welcome and incredibly friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: blumomoka
Reviews.Content: Spent three days in this charming hotel and we are made to feel so welcome. We were given tips on the best areas to visit, maps and directions and everything we needed to make this short trip so memorable! I will recommend this place to friends and colleagues and thinking about booking a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “a very very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: fmichal
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in an exelent location,close to the metro station the staff was very nice and helpful the room ws very clean and at a good size for a paris hotel highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in all of Europe”
Reviews.Author: socalarch
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Hotel Diana. I reserved a double room with a street view a couple months in advance and was thrown off when no credit card was required to hold the room. I was afraid we would show up and have no reservation waiting for us. But I confirmed the week before check-in and sure enough the room was held for us. Not only that but my flight was delayed due to bad weather and the staff was extremely accomodating. The room was small but clean and comfortable. The location near Notre Dame was perfect, so romantic to stroll along the Seine. The room was quiet with a cute street view, and felt very parisian. Clean bathroom. We stayed in 5 different hotels this trip, all of them more expensive than the hotel diana and this was my favorite. free wi-fi, and free access to a computer in the lobby to print your boarding passes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not bad price.”
Reviews.Author: amillionsteps
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel. It was very pretty and had a nice little lobby. The two complaints I have were the wi-fi really sucked. And always failed us. The other problem was that the bathtubs plugger mechanism didn't have a tight fitting seal so when we took our baths if we wanted to keep the water in we had to hold our foot over top it. The room was a little small and when they were cleaning other rooms we saw that eventhough we paid the higher price for the bigger room...all bigger rooms are not created equal. My other concern is that when you came back to the hotel to go up to your room....there wasn't really a check of security to make sure you were the room occupant. That is understandable when it was the same person you had seen before but when it was a new desk person they would just give you the key with out checking who you were. It was close to luxenburg gardens, the pantheon, notre dame, and wonder streets to just wander. The location of this hotel makes up for everything. And it was pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ronelr9
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Diana in two single rooms on our first and last night in Paris (in between we stayed in a nearby apartment for 7 nights). My friend said her room was quite small but perfectly adequate for two single nights, whereas my room was quite big (and I use the term loosely) for a single room in Paris. It was more like a small double, with a comfortably-sized bathroom, and I could see the Sorbonne from my window. The staff were helpful in booking us an early-morning taxi ride to the airport on our departure, and even hooked us up with two other guests who also had to leave early and wanted to share a taxi. That saved us some money. The location is terrific also. It's right in the heart of the Latin Quarter, with lots of restaurants around, the metro is nearby and you can walk across the bridge to the Marais in no time. All in all very good value (as long as they don't push up their prices too much!).

Reviews.Title: “A night in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AussieSophia
Reviews.Content: Damian @ the front desk - charming as ever! (It was in fact a lovely room!) The Hotel Diana accomodated me for a night when my original hotel accidently double booked me and sent me packing for the night. Despite the upheaval, my stay was pleasant and the room was so quaint! Lady @ breakfast was lovely and ensured I had a pleasant night even though I was originally booked into a higher star rated hotel. My biggest regret is not staying on for the rest of my stay and cancelling my previous hotel booking. Would recommend this little hotel to my friends! The staff will alway try their best to make you feel welcome and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to access Paris on foot!”
Reviews.Author: mrsveevee
Reviews.Content: Just back from Hotel Diana today, and it is the best hotel I have stayed in in Paris yet! Very reasonable price, rooms were clean and air conditioned with brilliant extras (fridge, safe, kettle), location is excellent: very safe, a minute's walk from the Boulevard St Germain so plenty of places to eat, and multiple Metro stations. However, we didn't use them too much as we walked easily from the hotel to the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Pantheon and the Jardin des Plantes. The staff were very friendly and helpful, there is a 24hr reception and a left luggage room which made our last day so much easier. I will definitely be staying at Hotel Diana again when I go back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and affordable stay!”
Reviews.Author: JulieDenmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Diana for 6 nights and we were very pleased with the hotel! It was very clean, newly renovated and the staff was freindly and helpful. Aircondition and safety box in the room. The location is perfect for exploring Paris! Highly recommendable and cheaper than most similar hotels i Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagpieBakes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located just a short walk from the RER. It is a basic, no-frills hotel that was clean. The bathroom was surprising big and it looked like it was renovated recently. The single elevator was small but the two of us with two suitcases was able to fit in snuggly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel. Great location. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: passingwind
Reviews.Content: Room was a standard Paris sized room, but the bathroom was bigger than others I've seen. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We didn't have breakfast, but it seemed like a good deal for the price. Great value. Good location for quick access to the Latin Quarter and St. Germain. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diana - Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: waynelim
Reviews.Content: We felt Hotel Diana was a very good budget hotel. Ideally located a few minutes from the Metro, Notre Dame, Lux Gardens and some of the most lively bustling streets in the Latin Quarter, we absolutely fell in love with Paris from this neighborhood. We liked hotel Diana because it was: - very welcoming (the most welcoming and helful staff I have seen in years!) - clean and decent rooms - economical - free wi-fi and free internet pc at the dining area - excellent and centrally located location Possible Improvements - Elevator was not working during our stay - I found the bed wasn't as comfortable as I would have liked, but I guess this is subjective because my wife snored through the night, and was corrected by a few more glasses of wine. Thank you Madam Chevel, Thomas and the rest of the staff. Our stay at Hotel Diana was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: nas_to_go
Reviews.Content: Nice place! nothing fancy, but comfortable and good value for this part of Paris. Also a nice part of town to stay - close enough to the action, but not very noisy. Only a few minutes walk to the Metro, Latin Quarter, Luxembourg Gardens, and Notre Dame. This hotel also has a small lift/elevator.

Reviews.Title: “1st Visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Silly2
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Diana before leaving Canada and no deposit or credit card was required, all they asked for was a confirmation e-mail one week prior, which we did from Holland. Getting the bus from Gare Nord-Gare L'Est was a little confusing however we made it. Our room was a little small..... however it's Paris and you're only in it for a few hours. The bathroom was a nice size, all tile and everything was very cleaned and well stocked. The location was excellent and we did the majority of the sights in Paris, ate in the Latin Quarter and stopped to have a cafe au lait and watch Paris. The staff was extremely helpful and we got a chance to practise our french and we are sure it amused them as well. Breakfast for 8 Euro was very nice; lots of selection. There was work going on the facia of the hotel however we were warned prior to booking so no surprise and certainly did not affect our stay as we were busy on tours, etc. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, no frills hotel with free and reliable WIFI access”
Reviews.Author: chameleon20
Reviews.Content: The location is very good as it's close to the metro and many attractions. Room is clean and have a hot water flask to boil hot water (which I don't find in other hotels which I stayed for the rest of my trip in Europe) Free WIFI access is very reliable as I can connect at anytime of the day. One of the staff doing night shift was nice to lend me the international adaptor through out my stay. However, there wasn't much interaction between the boss and other staff and ourselves and I was thinking it will be much better if they could inform us there's a train strike going on before we left the hotel for the airport. Luckily, we managed to reach the airport in time for our flight to Venice and got to know from some others at the airport that their hotel staff has informed them about the train strike and so they took the taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rumples
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day earlier than expected in Paris and required a hotel for one night before moving into an apartment. The Hotel Diana fitted our needs perfectly. It took about five minutes to walk to the hotel from the St. Michel RER B station, our destination from CDG. We had requested a quiet room, away from the street, and #34 allowed us the good night's sleep that we needed. Our room proved to be immaculate and looked like it had been renovated recently. It offered a flat-screen TV, safe, desk, chair and good lighting. The double bed was quite comfortable. and the closet, though small, served our needs. There was plenty of hot water and good water pressure in the modern bathroom. We had problems regulating the heat in the room, but opening a window gave us the needed comfort. My husband and I managed to just fit in the lift with our two carry-on bags, but I've seen even smaller elevators in Paris hotels. I cannot comment on the 8E breakfast, because we opted to eat outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly the best quality-price ratio in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dmitri_1795
Reviews.Content: In the very center of the town, in relativly quiet place, near metro and many bus stations, this hotel is the perfect starting point for exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: o2bnfr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Diana on my most recent trip to Paris. The room was small - but wonderfully efficient. Mme Cheval and her daughter greeted me warmly, and all the staff were most helpful. The breakfast for 7 euros was a feast that got me through the day. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and very good value for money ... but not quite perfect”
Reviews.Author: igar75
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in Paris in 12 months, and due to having young children in tow, I needed somewhere with a perfect location for exploring the city. And it doesn't get much better than this. The hotel is located a short walk from the Saint Michel-Notre Dame RER/Metro station, from where most parts of Paris can be reached within minutes. It is also on a direct line from Charles de Gaulle airport, so transfer from the plane was very easy. It is even closer to Cluny La Sorbonne Metro station, but this has more limited access to the various Metro lines. It is situated far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the Cluny area to make for a peaceful night's sleep, but a 2-minute stroll takes you to the middle of more bars, restaurants and cafes than you can shake a (particularly large) stick at. In short, perfectly located. The reception area is relatively small, and we encountered three reception staff during our three-night stay. Although some of them showing a reasonable knowledge of English, do expect to have to revert to French from time to time (which, to be fair, is only reasonable - you are in Paris, after all!). As a previous review mentioned, the lift is small. Two people plus suitcase is just about its limit. We stayed in a twin room on the first floor. No view from the window. Room was pleasant enough. Flatscreen TV (with no English channels), and with air-con (that wasn't on, albeit it was a chilly February week). Beds were pushed very close together, with limited room to separate them (so perhaps best avoided unless you are closely acquainted). We had the unnerving feeling that the floor sloped down towards the bathroom. Although we were unable to prove it, I'd be amazed if the floor was wholly level. Anyway, the bathroom was clean, and the room generally was the size you'd expect from a central Parisian hotel (ie. small, without being cramped). Previous reviews seem to rave about the breakfast. I'm not so convinced. It was standard Parisian fare - croissants, brioche and bread with butter and preserves, a choice of muesli, yoghurts and fruit. No "hot" options and, bearing in mind the price of 8 euros each, we preferred to walk into Cluny for 2 minutes and find a cafe serving much more substantial food for a reasonable price. Would I recommend this hotel? Well, if you are used to 4-star luxury and can afford to pay Parisian hotel prices, then no. There are far better choices. If you are not going to spend much time in the hotel, and simply want it as a base for sight-seeing and exploring the city whilst minimising the cost, then yes, yes, yes.

Reviews.Title: “An average room for an average cost...”
Reviews.Author: ozi-volleygal
Reviews.Content: A small but tidy room. Unfortunately there was only a hands width room between the twin beds, luckily I was travelling with a close friend. Bathroom clean and larger than expected. Tiny lift. Very close to alot of the attractions and restaurants, and the metro. Not overly expensive and a good result for the price.Helpful staff despite the language barrier.

Reviews.Title: “Best possible value at Hotel Diana”
Reviews.Author: sh9Edmonton_Canada
Reviews.Content: I could not have hoped to stay at a more wonderful hotel. With the great value offered by Mme Cheval, this small, family-owned hotel is one of the main reasons for the success of our trip to Paris. Mme Cheval is very helpful and gave us directions to wherever we needed to go. As well, the breakfast is very filling and a great value - oftentimes we were so full from the delicious breakfast (of which there is a wide variety for food selection) that lunch was unnecessary! We walked to nearly every possible location, excluding the Eiffel Tower (though one can easily take a bus to get there). The 5 minute proximity to Notre Dame is a great plus, as well as the even close Boulevard St. Michel. Though the rooms are small, they are functional - very clean and well decorated. We could not have hoped for anything more - a truly fantastic hotel! =)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, hightly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen37
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Location excellent, room and bathroom exceptionally clean. Flat screen tv, kettle, fridge, room safe, a/c (which wasn't on, but to be fair it was the end of November - room lovely and toasty) brand new bathroom with bath and shower, and all staff exceptionally pleasant and helpful. I hope after all these good reviews, I'll be able to book a room again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “no frills small hotel in a great location - did i say free wifi?”
Reviews.Author: travelgaljkt
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diana is perfect. Stayed for a week, it's a 5 minute walk to notre dame, pantheon, st germain and lots of little restaurants. There's also a convenient store 30meters away. Metro stops is St Michel or Clunny. Room is small, but CLEAN. Don't expect anything fancy, but its got everything you need. TV is on the downside, no english channel, so it was kinda pointless to watch tv for us. Bathroom is clean, with clean towels. It's basically a good bargain for the price in that location. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice hotel in great location at a very good price”
Reviews.Author: SonOfFatBeard
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with friends. Wasn't too sure what to expect before arriving as comared to other hotels I had looked at in Paris this one was very cheap. When I arrived I was pleasanly surprised, the hotel was well decorated and clean. It's location was perfect. Only a few minutes walk away from Notre Dame and other sites. The staff were very helpful and even offered to charge my iPod when it ran out before my trip home. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Paris, be it with friends or as couples.

Reviews.Title: “Mme Cheval runs a lovely hotel, "DIANA"!”
Reviews.Author: DRGVEG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 30th wedding anniversary in Paris.....The Hotel Diana was a perfect place to stay! Mme Cheval and her lovely daughter run a modern, spotless and warm feeling hotel....the rooms are modest in size....flat screen tv, free wifi, fairly large baths and a nice breakfst...for about 100 euros a night!!!! Without a doubt, the best bargain in all of Paris!!! We truly loved it! D Greve PITTSBURGH, USA

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect, well within our budget, lovely family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: jagjetfly
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the end of September, Madame Cheval was a lovely person who really does care for her hotel and guests. She is very accommodating and allowed us to check-in as soon as the room was ready, we were not made to wait until the afternoon as most hotels do. The rooms are spotless, I watched the cleaning lady one morning as she was cleaning the room below, the waste bin was scrubbed and polished until it shone. She was not aware I was watching. The beds were comfortable and appeared to have a heat mat of some sort in the upper part which melted the days site seeing pain in my back away. The bathroom was sparkling with a shower in the bath which is great, you can have a good soak and wash you hair at the same time. The rooms are an okay size for two people, with a fridge, desk and safe. Ours had a downward slant, which made me laugh as the hotel room I stayed in 30 years ago was the same. The location was superb, with a Metro stop 50 metres away, I didn't notice it until the day we left. This little hotel isn't the Ritz but is a quiet, no frills, value for money hotel that I would stay in anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit: again very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: birdsoup
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diana was safe, very clean, a decent value and so well-located for our last visit, we went back for the second time this year. We were again pleased with the condition of the rooms, the immaculate housekeeping, and we find the place quiet and friendly enough. The classical music on the radio in the lobby is a welcome breath of calm in a busy city. Our flat screen TV was tuned into the BBC station for us! The desk in the room was very useful for our 4 day stay. We liked Madame Cheval and enjoy talking with her, and when we need info, she is helpful. The location is superb. We love the close-by Cluny Museum and its herb garden for sitting--again, a peaceful place near the hectic Boul' St. Michel. The close and central metro and RER access to and from the airport (CDG), Versailles, the proximity to Notre Dame, the nearby Monoprix Dept. store (for small take out meals and drinks), the excitement of the Sorbonne area, as well as the Batobus stop down the street for cruising the Seine, make it very central and accessible. Try our favorite place, the Baker's Dozen, at the Place de la Sorbonne for bakery and sandwiches to go, and then sit at the outdoor tables! And, when you want another quiet retreat, go to Luxemburg Garden's "grotto". We've stayed at several other hotels in previous visits and will happily go back to the Diana in the future for its good value.

Reviews.Title: “Totally happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: abangthamai
Reviews.Content: Bearing in mind that this is a 2 star hotel, we were more than happy with the hotel. The room was small, but this was expected based upon reviews and the fact that most hotel rooms in Europe are small. But the room was clean, the bed decent, the shower and bathroom were nice and the closet had a safe. There was a mini fridge and small desk in the room as well which was also nice. There was an additional chair which took up space which we could have done without, but the tv was an updated flat screen which was appreciated as well. The only negative we had was upon arrival and the lobby smelling horribly of body odor. Apparently the man working there (caucasian with long dark hair) was the cause of it because the following morning the smell had diminished significantly and by the next evening it was pretty much non existent and a different man was at the desk. The young woman working in the morning was the most hospitable but we didn't have anyone that was outrightly rude, although a couple of the male workers were a bit odd... We would definitely stay there again, the location is wonderful in the Latin quartier close to shopping and restaurants. Notre Dame, Jardins de Luxembourg and the Louvre were all within walking difference. Overall a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised with the hype of other reviews”
Reviews.Author: DaveandKylee
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that our previous stay in Paris was nearly 10 ys ago, so accomodation prices have no doubt increased since then, but we're surprised by the enthusiasm shown in the other reviews towards value for money of the Hotel Diana. Location is very convenient to a number of the sites (but too far to walk to the Eiffel Tower) and the Latin Quarter is pretty cool. But, the rooms are so small !!!! The hotel rates itself as 2 star and I'd say this is pretty accurate. Room was definitely clean and breakfast was good value. Other than the young girl who worked on reception during the day the other staff were pretty grumpy and didn't make us feel as welcome as we expected they would (based on the other reviews)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Doire
Reviews.Content: First of all it must be remembered that this is a two star hotel so expect small rooms and less than perfect sound proofing.But once you get past that this little hotel is a real gem. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the ensuite bathroom is tremendous- the fittings are very modern,sparkling clean and work. Each room has very effective air conditioning,TV,fridge and security safe.The rooms are nicely tidied each day with fresh towels, soap etc. Try to get a front room .The view is non-existant in the rear facing rooms.The breakfast at €8 is really good value.That includes breakfast cereal,choice of fresh fruit,coffee,orange juice,croissant,toast etc.Much better value than local cafes or bistros. The staff are really friendly and helpful.The location is amazing.The towers of Notre- Dame can be seen from the front entrance and the nearest metro station (Cluny La Sorbonne) is a 2-3 minute stroll. The local area has a great selection of restaurants,bars and bistros. "La Petite Prince" 12 rue Lanneau is particularly nice .Local shopping is also very good.The nearest Monoprix supermarket on Bd. St-Michel is excellent and very handy if you're on a budget holiday. The €95 fee for a couple is tremendous value for Paris in peak season. Check out time is 12.00 midday and you can leave your suitcases in the hotel if you have a late flight. We will definitely return to Hotel Diana.Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Maria_M_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: Very clean accommodation in Paris in a very convenient, central location. (This is my third trip to Paris) We stayed for 3 nights and found it very good value. The reception was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MMPSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: My son (14 years) and I stayed at Hotel Diana from 12 - 16 July 2009 - 14 July was Bastille Day and the city was crowded - and were extremely happy with what we got. Sarah (do I have that right) at reception and Madame Therese (the owner) were fantastic people. The room (23) we stayed in was clean, big enough for the two of us and had everything and more. A fridge, kettle, hair dryer, tissues, soap and sjampoo. New towels everyday - bed being made. After arriving from London, this was a luxury to us. Location is excellent. View over Univercity of Sorbonne and a nice red blooming malva in our windowsill. We could walk to Notre Dame, Jardins de Luxembourgh, streets full of marvellous shops (remember the Monoprix supermarket nearby - ask at reception - when you live on a budget like we did) and the numerous take aways next to Metro Saint Michelle on your way to the Hotel. Very good location! I want to thank Madame Therese for even carrying part of our luggage downstairs the last day when the lift was serviced. She is a very kind lady.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: IndianDude
Reviews.Content: I travelled solo to Paris and Switzerland in June and early July. I stayed in Hotel Diana from June 20 to 26. Rate of 75 Euros per night, which is cheap considering the location is just 10 min from Notre Dame which is considered the center of Paris. Clean bathrooms and clean room. I had found the hotel in tripadvisor and found the reviews conforming with what I found. Reception is open 24 7. You would have to ring the bell or knock on the door if you return late in the night as the door is locked. A good place in central paris to crash in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem on the Left Bank.”
Reviews.Author: kuldalai
Reviews.Content: This hidden gem is at 73 Rue St Jacques right in the heart of the Sorbonne. Within 15 minutes a world of low cost eating places (by Parisian standards). Within easy walking distance of the Seine, Notre Dame etc . Just off the Boulevard St Michel . Direct access from CDG Airport by RER Line B to St. Michel station . Close to Metro at Cliny/la Sorbonne station. Rooms are smallish but with excellent en-suite and TV and spotlessly clean . Great continental breakfast in range and quality is 8 Euros. Great location and good value by Parisian standards . Quiet location. Friendly staff, you can book on line direct to the hotel via their website .

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: dskla064
Reviews.Content: The Diana is located a block away from the Cluny Metro and the rooms have modern amenities. Aside from that, I was very displeased. First, Mme Cheval, the woman at the front desk is quite cold and rude. When I told her I had a reservation (in French) I was snapped at "passeport." After showing her my passport, she looked up something on the computer, then threw a set of keys on the table and said "63." That was it. Later, when I asked for a taxi for 7:30 the next morning, I was told it wouldn't be a problem. When I woke up, I was told that it could not be done because it was the beginning of the French vacation, whatever that was supposed to mean. Aside from that, the room was quite dirty; a whole bunch of M&M type candies all around the floor. There was a kettle, but no cups, tea or anything. There was an air conditioner, but there were notices in both the room and the front desk that we should avoid using it. Overall, I did not feel welcome in this 2 star property and would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: LondonOnttraveller
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the staff were helpful, and the rooms were clean (small, but for the price, good). I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gaizka100
Reviews.Content: Like other hotels in Paris the rooms here are pretty small, so you don´t have to be disappointed once you open the room door. You are paying here 95 eur for a hotel 5 minutes walking from Notre Dame, spotless clean, soundproof as any other hotel in Paris and even with nice views to the Sorbonne if your room is facing the street. Before I booked here I searched for other hotels and the price here cannot be really beaten for the same location, and all the reviews from Trip advisor about the hotel are quite fair. Regarding the booking, a credit card is NOT required, but they only allow the booking within 3 months before the arrival date.The staff is doesn´t seem specially helpful, but as I didn´t have problems I didn´t have to talk with them too much. For my next time in Paris, I will be here again. Also, as last recommendation, we used to go for lunch / dinner to the St Michel area, but last day we just went in the opposite direction and we found Mouffetard street. There are not big sights in the area, so there are less tourists and more frenchs, and a huge amount of bars and restaurants in a pedestrian area.

Reviews.Title: “Towels in corredor”
Reviews.Author: viajjante
Reviews.Content: " We stay at the hotel until noon and dirty towels were in the hallway all day. When bathing the whole bathroom is wet because there is no curtain or box in some rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad = you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: SSSteph
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and will say that the price (95 Euro/night) was very good but for sure this is a BUDGET hotel. The main issue that soured my stay was with the sheets, (and no I don’t even have a thread count higher than 250 at home either). These were so rough that I had to use a sarong on top of them to sleep comfortably. The location is very central with many stores, restaurants and the metro just around the block so you cannot beat the convenience. There are many food options nearby so I did not bother with the hotel's breakfast. The staff was OK, except for the older lady who went on a rant one morning about not using the A/C when the temp is below 25C/77F. As soon as I could get a word in, I told her that I had not even turned it on, to which she just said “Oh, well now you know”. Room # 51 was tiny and a very garish orange that did make me take a step back when I opened the door, so if you don’t like bright colors this is definitely not for you. The upside was the cute flower box on the window and the fact that I was on one of the top floors over looking the rooftops of the city. The bathroom was clean, but again tiny with the typical hand held shower over the tub with no curtain. Having lived in Europe, I am used to the small nature of living quarters, but this was for sure on the super small side. Case in point: you hit the refrigerator when you enter/exit the bathroom. I would recommend this place for people who want to save money, but the next time I visit Paris I’ll try to bid on Priceline for a 3-4 star place for the same amount. Worst case scenario if I don’t win the bid, I can stay here again and bring my own sheets. Lastly, try not to stay next to the elevator because you can hear it all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Small yet has it all”
Reviews.Author: TMLAalum
Reviews.Content: Yes, our double room was tiny and the bathroom a tad tight, but the plusses of LOCATION, A/C, elevator, amenities such as hair dryer & tv, and most of all the 95 euro per night tariff, made our stay at Hotel Diana practically perfect. Even though we faced the Rue St. Jacques, double-paned windows kept out the street noise. We were only there one night, but could have easily managed for a longer stay even though the room was small. We had an early flight the next day, so didn't have breakfast there although from what I could see of the petite dejeuner being served to other guests, it appeared to be typical for Paris. Staff was very courteous and helpful and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: JerrodKowalski
Reviews.Content: Conflicted reviewer. Good location, less than perfect rooms. i am very conflicted about this hotel and how to review it with "Yes or No" answers. i will start with the good stuff. Functional, quiet, central, safe, value. The price was good. There were no bugs. it seemed safe. most of the staff were friendly and helpful. it was Quiet, at least in room 51. there was a mini fridge in the room and the lift (elevator) worked. WiFi was free. it is also very close to Notre Damn, Luxembourg gardens, metro, food market, yada, yada. That was all good and allowed us to eat at a fair price and walk to sites. The free WiFi was great too, but it cut off my Skype calls on my iPhone, not happy about the filtering. Now the bad news. Based on the reviews i read on this site you would think this hotel is very good, especially for Paris. Maybe it is good far Paris, or maybe the rooms vary widely. To be fair the room was not really very dirty, but it was not especially clean. The things that made it seem worse were the very dated decor and the old towels and linens. It looked like it was from the 70's. It is also a very tiny room, but the bathroom was big for Europe. And no they don't have a shower curtain, so you have to sit in the tube to shower and not make a mess, what a pain. If this is a good hotel for Paris, then i have to warn everyone about going to Paris. i do see that most hotels are double or triple in price, but the rooms could have been decent with $150 in updates to linens, curtains (shower too) and decor, seriously. Also the desk takes up a hug amount of space and is just too big for a tiny room. Another annoyance was that the person who cleaned the room every day insisted on a full "reset". Despite asking to not have the sheets tucked in or the furniture moved it was done every day to the point that the stool and the chair tucked in under the desk were switched back to the "original" location every day even though i swapped them every day. Not moved around the room, but switched sides under the desk; how OCD is that? The bed was hard and the linens were clean, but basic. The sheet was right on top of the bed, no pad or 2nd sheet, a little yucky for me. All this matters to me because 2 other friends from work had just come back from Paris on separate trips. Having heard their stories in person i still choose this hotel based on the reviews; statistically valid based on the number of them. I can not say that the other reviews are wrong. I do think maybe the standards of the other reviewers is low OR they had differently styled rooms OR Paris has pretty poor private hotels. Did i mention you could touch the bathroom door from the bed if you laid down head to toe? (i snore so my wife likes that arrangement). So here is the deal, i suggest to the hotel that they spend the $150 and get the bed pad, curtain(s), new linens and new colors for God's sake. Dump the desk or get a smaller one. i know you don't spend much time in your room, but my wife was al but desperate to avoid going back to the hotel. if this does not bother you, the good comments are valid, enjoy your stay. Other comments; i travel for pleasure and for work. i have stayed at more than 100 hotels in the last decade. i spend more than 60 nights a year in hotels. it was my first time to Parisso i can not compare directly; my review stands by itself, but based on pricing, reviews and research and other information i believe it to be valid. i have been to Europe about 5 years ago for 3 weeks; this trip was 2 weeks. i have stayed in 5 other similarly independent Europe hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit expensive but very good!”
Reviews.Author: proscola
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights in May/09. Excelent location and you can go to the Notre Dame, Pantheon, Jardin de Luxemburg by foot. There are many places where you can eat and buy things in a good price. As I am a solo traveler, I thought it a little bit expensive, but the hotel was great: clean, cozy, well-located. Maybe the only problem that I found was the sound of the elevator which was just next to my room and I could hear the engine when it was moving. I can't say anything about the service because I just used the hotel to take a shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: joseph62
Reviews.Content: This centrally located hotel on rue St. Jacques had few drawbacks. The twin rooms were small but adequate. Room 15, although up a few steps from the tiny elevator, was slightly bigger, but had an larger, updated bathroom with a glass door on the tub. The hotel provides free WiFi. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, ideally located, warm and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 8wanderlust
Reviews.Content: I traveled throughout Europe and Hotel Diana was by far the best B&B. Madame Cheval and her staff were always genuinely friendly and very efficient. As a solo traveler, I had ample space to maneuver in the room, which was equipped with a hair dryer, refrigerator, flat screen and telephone (Note: they do not tax you any addt'l charges, I practically rushed my parents off the phone only to find out later the 10-min call was under 2 euros!). I was on the 6th floor and had no trouble falling fast asleep, no collateral noise from guests either. Diana is in a great location in the Latin Quarter (close by, but not heavy in the mix), just a stone's throw away from the Notre Dame, St. Michel RER, Cluny Metros and buses. I'm apprehensive about posting my thoughts here because I don't want Hotel Diana to be overbooked when I surely return, but TripAdvisor reviews are what led me to this gem so I feel I must reciprocate. Overall, this is a charming hotel, if you want clean, comfort, friendly, affordable accommodations in a central location, stay here. One last thing - as a 28-yr old solo female traveler, the paranoia friends/family equipped me with on my travels was completely unfounded. Every morning I diligently (and begrudgingly) locked everything away in my luggage. One night, after a long day of museuming and market excursions, I came back to the hotel and saw my diamond earring placed on the side table. Unbeknownst to me, I must have dropped it in the shuffle of my packing paranoia! The chambermaid sweetly and honestly rescued my earring. I will never ever forget this. Merci beaucoup Madame Cheval and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, great location at a decent price.”
Reviews.Author: 2BGartists
Reviews.Content: The Hotel DIana worked perfect as a base for our long weekend visiting museums and the city of lights. Super easy to find from the train station using the metro. The rooms were fine and bathroom had good water pressure and hot water. Our room, on the second floor street-side, was a bit loud and the walls were thin. The other guests were quiet so this was not a big deal. If you are a light sleeper ask for a room on the courtyard or bring earplugs. I would stay again because at 95 euros for a double room we felt it was a deal for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and just right for our stay!”
Reviews.Author: sareduf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Diana for a week for our honeymoon. The rooms are small (as are most in Paris) but are extremely clean! We had a double bed which was fine for us. There is an elevator. It was extremely quiet, we didn't hear a peep from any of the other guests. There is a sizable closet, nice TV, a small desk and a pretty big bathroom. The shower has a half door, which is fine. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is great, right next to a Metro/RER station and very close to Notre Dame. And the price can't be beat. Hotel Diana helped us have an excellent honeymoon in Paris, I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: Rod the dog
Reviews.Content: Smart, clean hotel in an excellent location - all for a great price (E90 per night). This venue represents excellent value in what is generally a very expensive city. Spent 3 nights at this Paris hotel with my wife over the valentines day weekend. How romantic you say. Truth is I had tickets for France v Scotland 6 Nations! I picked this hotel on the strength of it's Tripadvisor rating and it was everything the reviews promised. The proprietress, Therese, met us at reception on arrival with a warm welcome. She gave us a Paris guide and highlighted all the major tourist attractions for us. The double room was compact but of a size typical to this style of hotel. The decor was tasteful, modern and clean. The bathroom was spotless. The suite was new, and the bath although fairly small, was perfectly adequate. There were no coffee or tea making facilities in the room which is not unusual in France, but it was a nice touch that when I went downstairs on the first morning to ask if I could buy 2 cups of tea, Therese gave me a kettle, tea bags and milk, and said I could hang onto them for the duration of our stay, and wouldn't accept any money for it! This was our second trip to Paris but the first time we'd been to the Latin Quarter. We loved it. A 5 minute walk up the hill brings you to the Pantheon, and just behind that, a network of streets housing bars and a host of restaurants. Popular with students, prices are very inexpensive for Paris and you can pick up a pint of beer for E3.50 and a 3 course evening meal for E14.00. Lunchtime offers are even cheaper. The atmosphere is lively and very friendly. A five minute walk down the hill from the hotel will bring you to Notre Dame where you can continue along the river to The Louvre, Champs Elysees, Arc de Triomphe etc. Overall a great hotel, great location and a great city. Wish I could say the same about the Scotland rugby team!

Reviews.Title: “Completely sastisfied”
Reviews.Author: BigBaaadBob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located, clean, and friendly. Our room was utilitarian (small for Americans, maybe) but comfortable, and the bathroom was a good size. There is a small elevator, good enough for two people with bags, which is nice for checking in, and a stairway for when you don't want to wait. The desk staff were pleasant and knew enough English to give good answers to questions (my French is pathetic). Before our stay I had communicated several times via email with Therese who was very helpful. The breakfast was adequate and filling. They provided free WiFi. All-in-all a very good value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget option in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jvbt
Reviews.Content: Great find in Paris! Location is perfect. Nice area, close to Notre Dame, seine, etc. Room was very clean. And stuff was very helpful answering all our questions and printing out maps and information for us from the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: KLTS
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance went to Paris for a long weekend, We choose the Diana Hotel after looking the tripadvisor site. We are so happy to did this. Because the Hotel was great. The combination of good price, very clean and warm room and huge breakfast was great. We will use this Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: GypsyFleur
Reviews.Content: Based in the latin quarter near the La Sabonne University, this hotel is walking distance to most of Paris's major sites. The Seine is 8 minutes on foot and there are lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. The nearest Metro is 2 minutes on foot. Normally you would expect to pay a lot for a Hotel in such a location, however Hotel Diana is clean and very good value. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. We loved it and would definately stay again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The definitive Paris budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott408
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Paris for over 30 years and stayed in a wide range of hotels. The Hotel Diana is something special. Six members of my family went to Paris to celebrate ny 60th birthday. This was my treat to the family but there is a limit to my wealth! I selected the Hotel Diana from theTrip Advisor reviews and was not the slightest bit disappointed in the hotel. It's a small (20 rooms?) family-owned hotel and the rooms are certainly rather on the small side. But they were spotless and the bathroom looked as though it had been installed the previous day. The staff were incredibly helpful and all spoke good English. Breakfast could get a little crowded but the hot croissants and fresh fruit salad were worth the wait. The location could not be better. 10 minutes from Notre Dame, about the same from the RER station serving the airports, and close to cross-town bus routes. There is a bicycle-hire station across the road and as it is in the Sorbonne area there is an endless range of resturants. The hotel staff are very good at suggesting places to see in the area around the hotel. The only downsides were the lack of a shower curtain and one needed to hold the shower rather than clipping it to the wall. If you are looking for a hotel with a bar, restaurant and rooms to while away the afternoon then this is not for you. For a short-stay visit to Paris for business or pleasure I doubt it can be beaten, I;ll never stay anywhere else. Scott 408

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: suzafred
Reviews.Content: Great location, great breakfast, helpful and accommodating staff. Rooms small by American standards, but extremely clean. Small closet..don't take too many clothes. Convenient to Metro, restaurants, Rue Moufftard, Notre Dame. Couldn't have been happier with the hotel, except maybe with a shower curtain. We made due. Proprietress is very helpful and accommodating. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: scubagirlUk
Reviews.Content: Last year I went to Paris and had a disappointing stay in Montmartre; the hotel was over-priced with shabby room furnishings, trading purely on the picturesque location. This time I was in Paris on a shopping trip with my Mum and wanted to stay somewhere different. I chose the Hotel Diana in the Latin Quarter based on the good Tripadvisor reviews. This time I was really pleased with my choice. The hotel is really good value for money, and in a great location - just down the road from lots of bars, brasseries and cafes, 10 mins walk to the Notre Dame and 2 mins walk to the Pantheon. The room was spotless - the bathroom looked brand new! It was also very quiet. Based on my experience (I only stayed one night) I can't criticise anything. I would choose the Latin Quarter and this hotel over Montmartre any day!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and unbeatable price”
Reviews.Author: alpanian
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located near the lively latin quarter should be one of the top central Paris hotels for any budget conscious traveller. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The bathrooms are modern too, in fact it seems like they may have renovated not too long ago. May I suggest though to install some basic shower curtains? Keeping the water inside the tub was not that easy.... We also had no problems with noise, as can often be the case in these small places. Getting to public transport (RER, Metro) was a 2 min walk. Even the Notre Dame was only a 5 min walk. Stay here on your next trip to Paris!! It beats anything in the under 200 EUR range (cost us 90 EUR +bkfst).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: agl120854
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel via email via their web site. No problems with the reservation, even though they did not require a deposit to hold the room. Arrived early in the morning after the overnight flight from the US and they had a room ready so we could get in a short nap before heading out to see the city. We were shown a room in the front but we worried that it would be too noisy, and took a room in the back facing an inner courtyard. I wish we had been able to change after that first day because it was rather dark and the rooms in the front were quiet enough. The rooms are microscopic as previously described, a bed and 2 feet of room on the other three sides. The bathrooms are renovated, clean and shiny, nice for Paris, however a shower curtain would have kept our stuff from getting wet as others have pointed out. Sparkling clean room and fine beds. The hotel lobby is stark and not conducive to just sitting there and reading. No one ever hung out in the lobby. The elevator was not working for the duration of our 4 night stay and had it been we would have taken a higher floor facing the front. . All in all I'm not quite sure why the hotel is as popular as it is in the Tripadvisor listing, however it is a great find and bargain for Paris, and the location is great. Just dont expect anything more. There are many restaurants within a 3 block radius, some exceptionally good such as Le Petit Prince and Le Pre Vere, in addition to the touristy restaurants closer to St. Michelle. Taking the RER to and from CDG was easy with an entrance to the metro 2 blocks from the hotel. As a note the Picasso exhibit at the Grand Palais is fabulous and I would recommend that anyone buy their tickets ahead of time because our wait was about 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in quartier latin”
Reviews.Author: VosBennebroek
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel on an excellent location. friendly staff, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to recommendations”
Reviews.Author: catmac59
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading Trip Advisor reviews and our staying there really contributed to our enjoyment of Paris. Mme Cheval an her staff are just lovely to deal with. Breakfast is served from 7.30 to 10.30 and is delicious, with a slightly different selection each day. For only 8 euros it is very reasonably priced. Muesli, fruits fresh and stewed, yoghurt, followed by a basket of pastries and bread (yesterday there were pancakes), with cheeses and spreads, plus a choice of cafe, the or chocolat. We ate out one morning and had a mere fraction of the choice for more money. Room was in very good order and very clean. We had a room beside the lift and it didn't bother us - found the hotel quiet. They also don't charge extra for phone calls, just the going rate! It is located in a central, beautiful and vibrant part of Paris and was perfect for us first time visitors. As we left this morning it had been raining and the soft yellow streetlights refelcted off the cobblestones... ah, the romance of Paris....

Reviews.Title: “Small but (nearly) perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: W0rcesterW0man
Reviews.Content: Agree with many previous comments.... it's why we picked the hotel directly from this site, and we weren't disappointed. Rooms small but v comfy (will upload some photos when I remember). Breakfast fine, but I wouldnt rave about it - sometimes fruit and yoghurt choice v small, especially if you aren't early. But all fresh, croissants baked on site I believe. Location perfect - as well as other comments, only 10 mins walk from Notre Dame and a stack of touristy but fine restaurants in the Latin quarter. NB Fab jazz club (Caveau de la Huchette) within that area also, well worth a visit. However - the hotel itself is very quiet, although do ask for a room facing away from the street - which they were happy to provide. English beautifully spoken, although (as always) it is much appreciated if you can at least attempt some French - I found that all over Paris. All in all a super stay - would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a perfect Parisian accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Kabyle-2010
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel as a mother with her 15 year old daughter. The hotel is located right in front of La Sorbonne, its not even a 5 minute walk to le Pantheon, an 8 minute walk to les Jardins du Luxembourg, a very enjoyable 20 minute (at the maximum) walk to Jardin des Plantes and La Grande Mosquee de Paris. It was also a 5minute walk to le Cathedrale de Dame, la Sainte-Chapelle, and Palais de Justice. It takes 1 minute to geth to the Cluny museum of medieval art. Its a 1 minute walk to the metro station Cluny-La Sorbonne. The hotel has an incomparably excellent location with great reastaurants within a stone's throw with a wide range of restaurants whether one wants to eat at a Traditional French restaurant in the Rue Mouffettard area or at the inexpensive Monoprix for a sandwich to take back to the hotel for lunch. The hotel offers breakfast at (i think) 8 euros that offers: pomegranate, bananas, figs, prunes, grapes, 4 types of cheese, nutella, honey, butter, yogurt, croissant, bread, orange juice, coffe, tea, and other yummy fresh-out-of-the-oven pastries. Bakeries don't open until 10 am (at leats in august) whereas one can the hotel's breakfast is offered from 7am-10am.
