This hotel is family-run, having belonged to Mme Cheval's parents and now in her hands with the help of her daughter. There are 23 rooms, with unbelievably reasonable rates for the famously shockingly expensive Paris. The owner is extremely nice and helpful having explained to us how to use public transport, advised us on how to get to the airport for cheaper, always pleasant with and open to discussions about the culture. We booked stayed in room 33 with a double bed and did not find it small seeing as we were mentally prepared for the difference between North American and European standards. Europe and its large cities are just generally lacking in space. The bed was very comfortable and same with the pillows. The room comes equipped with a small desk with storage, a tv, a chair, a large closet with storage, air conditioning, and a blow dryer (though I personally prefferred a more modern one for my hair). The room was extremely clean, I couldnt not have been happier. The bathroom are decently sized with a pedestal sink and bathtub. The bathtub has a handheld showerhead but there is no shower curtain so one has to shower sitting but we found that that worked perfectly fine. Th elevator was small and could fit my daughter and I with one large suitcase comfortably. The view is beautiful onto the Rue Saint-Jacques and the 2 large windows successfully blocked out all possible noise from the street. It was thanks to the fabulous hotel Diana that we adored our stay in the city of lights and we intend to return a countless number of times at the hotel. It is located in the 5th arrondissement in the Latin Quarter of the left bank of the Seine river. We stayed from the 12th of august and left the morning of the 23rd. I really believe that this hotel is perfect for anyone, except maybe a younger person with the intention to do more late-night partying than sightseeing. Otherwise, you won't be disappointed with this hotel. Oh, and did I mention that the hotel owner speaks english??

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Napen01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! Had a real unique french feel, was clean, quiet and staff were very pleasant! The rooms were modern, perfectly adequate size and the bathroom was spotless. Near a metro station and plenty of places to eat. Great price! Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bobbyd737
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights the first week in May and couldn't be more pleased with Hotel Diana. Great location only a short walk from the Notre Dame Cathedral and Park Luxembourg. Also, one block from subway station that has direct service to Charles de Gaulle Airport. Room was very clean, was a normal size, had windows that opened and air conditioning. I did not have the optional breakfast. I will definately stay there again when in Paris. Thank you to my fellow tripadvisor reviewers. This really is a great website!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Diana!!!”
Reviews.Author: BobMarcel
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent four nights at the Hotel Diana and loved it. The location was perfect in the 5th arondissement, Quatier Latin. We could see Notre Dame Cathedral from our room. The room was a bit small but the bathroom was quite large and very clean. The breakfast in the morning was delicious....fresh croissants, fresh fruits, biscuits, preserves and delicious capuccino! The staff was very friendly and accommodtaing! The price was very attractive and we would definitely stay here again. Thank you to Hotel Diana for a very pleasant stay! Bob & Marcel Salem, MA USA

Reviews.Title: “best value hotel of the trip”
Reviews.Author: ekr06
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the hotel Diana during our recent trip to Paris. Due to last minute travel plans we were unable to make advanced reservations and therefore stayed at 4 hotels during the trip. The Hotel Diana was the best overall value with very friendly staff, clean rooms, great location and a nice price for what you get (elevator, a/c, internet). The only trouble we had was that they overbooked and told us half way through our stay that we would not be able to keep the room. This was a huge inconvenience, but they were very helpful and willing to call other places to help us find another place to stay so it worked out in the end. We will definitely make reservations at the Hotel Diana on our next trip to Paris to ensure we can stay here. For a value hotel, it is has every accommodation we were looking for and is in the heart of the Latin Quarter, down the street from the Notre Dame and within walking distance to great shopping, restaurants and several metro stops.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Diana
HotelInfo.Address: 73 Rue Saint-Jacques | 5 Arr, 75005 Paris, France
